intro: Oenothera elata subsp. elata, commonly known as the tall evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. Oenothera elata subsp. elata is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions.
